page.title: 12Travel to Work
page.content: Unlike commuters in some parts of Britain workers living in our block enjoy easy access to their place of work and this is also reflected in their choice of transport. With good roads and public transport it may seem odd that the tradition of living close by the work place persists. Half our sample work less than 2 m from home;22% travel up to 3 m into Gateshead;only 16% travel 5 m into Newcastle and a mere 4% travel either up to 12 m within Tyneside or up to 20 m beyond. Travel to work on foot is common (29%) particularly among those in Lobley Hill working on nearby Team Valley Estate. Almost equal numbers use bus and car (35%), though car use in Whickham is more common (50%).
